meanings.definition: To celebrate jointly or together with others.
meanings.sent1: The community will concelebrate the holiday with a big parade.
meanings.sent2: Family and friends often concelebrate birthdays by throwing a party.
meanings.sent3: Let's concelebrate the end of exams with a movie night!
meanings.sent4: The team will concelebrate their victory with a celebratory dinner.
meanings.sent5: We should concelebrate our achievements to boost morale.

meanings.definition: To participate in a religious ceremony with others.
meanings.sent1: The priests will concelebrate the Sunday service at the church.
meanings.sent2: Many believers come together to concelebrate important religious festivals.
meanings.sent3: It's always heartwarming to concelebrate weddings in the community.
meanings.sent4: The monks will concelebrate the sacred ritual in unity.
meanings.sent5: Let us concelebrate the spiritual journey with devotion and joy.
